qas.question: Who first sold a million copies on CD?
Which artist was the first to have their full catalogue converted to CD?
What year was the Dire Straits album Brothers in Arms released?
How many CDs were mass produced in 1988?
How many studio albums did David Bowie release in February 1985?

context: The Japanese launch was followed in March 1983 by the introduction of CD players and discs to Europe and North America (where CBS Records released sixteen titles). This event is often seen as the "Big Bang" of the digital audio revolution. The new audio disc was enthusiastically received, especially in the early-adopting classical music and audiophile communities, and its handling quality received particular praise. As the price of players gradually came down, and with the introduction of the portable Walkman the CD began to gain popularity in the larger popular and rock music markets. The first artist to sell a million copies on CD was <a0_0>Dire Straits<a0_0/>, with their <a2_0>1985<a2_0/> album Brothers in Arms. The first major artist to have his entire catalogue converted to CD was <a1_0>David Bowie<a1_0/>, whose <a4_0>15<a4_0/> studio albums were made available by RCA Records in February 1985, along with four greatest hits albums. In 1988, <a3_0>400 million<a3_0/> CDs were manufactured by 50 pressing plants around the world.
